attributes.action: Restore tax credits for privately funded pension schemes (removed by Gordon Brown in 1997 budget) and reduce his own personal pension and those of other government ministers by the same amount as has been lost by private sector pensioners as a result of this iniquitous legislation.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gordon Brown's decision in 1997 to eliminate tax credits on privately funded pension schemes has resulted in substantial reduction in pensions for millions of pensioners not fortunate enough to be members of privileged public sector schemes such as his own. It is contrary to any principles of common justice that government ministers can impose penalties to which they themselves are not subject. Ministers' pension schemes should be discontinued and the funds transferred to private sector schemes to ensure that the consequences of any such future legislation impact Government ministers at a personal level.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
